cantDisableMeshWithSecondaries: Cannot disable mesh with associated secondaries ({{errorline}})
cantDeleteMeshWithSecondaries: Cannot delete CPE on mesh with associated secondaries ({{errorline}})
nonTr069AcsSyncError: Attempt to sync acs data with non-tr-069 device ({{errorline}})

acsSpeedTestFileUnavailable: Error: Could not get speedtest measure file ({{errorline}})

acsSiteSurveyError: Error: Could not fire TR-069 site survey ({{errorline}})
noMoreTr069Licences: Your account is out of licenses for TR-069 CPEs left. Please contact your sales representative ({{errorline}})
tr069LicencesLeft: Your account has only {{n}} CPE TR-069 licenses left. Please contact your sales representative ({{errorline}})
firmwareVersionNotFound: There is no firmware with this version ({{errorline}})
errorSendingMeshParamtersToCpe: Error sending mesh parameters to CPE
cpeIsNotMeshSlave: Device is not a mesh secondary! ({{errorline}})
primaryCpeNotInMeshMode: CPE designated as primary is not in mesh mode ({{errorline}})
primaryCpeIsSecondary: CPE indicated as primary is secondary ({{errorline}})
secondaryCandidateCpeNotCompatibleWithMe: Secondary candidate CPE is not supported by mesh v2 ({{errorline}})
secondaryCandidateCpeAlreadyAssignedTo: Secondary Candidate CPE is already registered as a secondary of {{mesh_master}} ({{errorline}})
secondaryCandidateCpeCannotBeTr069: Secondary candidate CPE cannot be TR-069 ({{errorline}})
secondaryCandidateCpeNotOnline: Secondary candidate CPE is not online ({{errorline}})
secondaryIndicatedCpeMacInvalid: CPE MAC indicated as invalid secondary ({{errorline}})
secondaryIndicatedCpeNotFound: CPE indicated as secondary not found ({{errorline}})
secondaryIndicatedCpeNotAssignedToPrimar: CPE indicated as secondary has no associated primary ({{errorline}})
secondaryIndicatedCpeHasSecondariesAssig: CPE indicated as secondary has associated secondary CPEs ({{errorline}})
secondaryIndicatedCpeNotInPrimaryList: CPE designated as secondary is not in the list of secondaries for the CPE designated as primary
cannotDisassocWhileUpdating: Cannot disassociate a secondary CPE while updating
bodyNotObject: Body received, in the request, is not an object ({{errorline}})
idInvalidInUrlParams: ID '{{-id}}' received in url parameters is invalid ({{errorline}})
ssidPrefixInvalidLength: Could not enable SSID prefix as the maximum length of 32 characters was exceeded ({{errorline}})
firmwareHasBeenModifiedLocally: This Flashbox firmware has been modified or replaced locally ({{errorline}})
meshSecondaryUpdateError: This CPE is secondary in a mesh network, its update must be done from the main CPE of that network
functionToSetSlaveToUpdate: This function should only be used to mark a secondary CPE to update, not to cancel the update
commandOnlyWorksInsideSession: This command only works in one session!
enableWifiToConfigureMesh: To configure this type of mesh it is necessary to enable all Wi-Fi
disableMeshNotPossibleWithSecundaries: Cannot disable mesh with associated secondaries
fieldsInvalidCheckErrors: Error validating the fields, see field "errors"
cpeWithoutLogs: There is no log for this CPE
cpeNotInBridgeCantOpenPorts: This CPE is in bridge mode, and therefore cannot allow access to ports
macInvalidInJson: Invalid Device MAC Address Data In JSON
internalPortsInvalidInJson: Invalid Device Internal Ports in JSON
cpeNotAcceptingSymmetricalPorts: CPE does not support asymmetric ports
externalAndInternalPortsIncorrectInJson: Internal and External ports do not match in JSON
cpeWithoutCommand: CPE does not support this command
serviceNotConfiguredByAdmin: This service has not been configured by the administrator
portsSouldBeBetweenError: {{ip}}: The ports must be in the range between 1 - 65535 (Due to the particular application of the TR-069 device, the following ports are also not allowed: 22, 23, 80, 443, 7547 and 58000)
firmwareAlreadyExists: It is not possible to register more than one firmware for a given model/version ({{errorline}})
updateAbortedCpeInstallingFirmware: Update aborted - CPE was installing firmware
ssidPrefixDisabledAlterationError: SSID prefix cannot be changed if disabled
tr069WebPasswordValidationError: The password for the web interface of the TR-069 CPEs is not in the expected standards
parametersErrorNoCpe: Error processing parameters: no CPE found ({{errorline}})
parametersErrorTimeRangesInvalid: Error processing parameters: invalid time ranges ({{errorline}})
errorDuringTopologyValidation: An error occurred while validating the topology
errorDuringTopologyCollect: An error occurred while collecting the topology
updateStartFailedMeshNetwork: Failed to start mesh network update
updateAbortedCpeSearchingTopology: Update aborted - CPE was fetching topology
updateAbortedCpeDownloadingFirmware: Update aborted - CPE was downloading firmware
updateAbortedUpdatingMeshOldToNew: Update aborted - updating mesh from old pattern to new one
passwordExpired: Your password has expired. Please enter a new password ({{errorline}})
nameCantBeBiggerThan23: Error creating user. Name cannot be longer than 23 characters ({{errorline}})
userMightAlreadyExist: Error creating user. Check if user already exists ({{errorline}})
firmwareUpdateControllConflict: Class Conflict Error: Strict Firmware Update Control without Firmware Update Control ({{errorline}})
firmwareBetaUpdateControllConflict: Class Conflict Error: Beta Firmware Update Control without Firmware Update Control ({{errorline}})
roleMightAlreadyExist: Error creating role. Check if it already exists ({{errorline}})
certificateDeleteErrorContactDev: Internal error deleting certifications. Please contact the developer ({{errorline}})
userDeleteErrorContactDev: Internal error deleting user(s). Please contact developer ({{errorline}})
roleDeleteErrorContactDev: Internal error deleting role(s). Contact developer ({{errorline}})
rolesStillInUse: Error deleting role(s). One or more roles are still in use by their users ({{errorline}})
accountCreditsExpired: Your provider's Anlix account is locked. Check for overdue invoices and contact your sales representative ({{errorline}})
cpeSignalLevelReceivedInDbm: Signal level received at the CPE in dBm
invalidContractNumberKind: {{kind}} is not a valid identification type
invalidContractNumberData: {{kind}} cannot be different from the pattern "{{mask}}"!
certificateLongitude: Longitude at the time of certification
vlanIdOutOfRange: VLAN ID cannot be less than 3 or greater than 4094! ({{errorline}})
vlanProfileNameInvalidCharacter: The VLAN Profile name must start with an alphabet character, contain alphanumeric characters, hyphen or underscore, cannot be empty, and must be distinct from existing ones! ({{errorline}})
vlanProfileNameInvalidLength: VLAN Profile name must not be longer than 32 characters! ({{errorline}})
vlanProfileIdExists: A VLAN profile already exists with this given ID! ({{errorline}})
vlanProfileNameExists: A VLAN profile with that given name already exists! ({{errorline}})
vlanProfileNameShouldBeDifferent: VLAN Profile name must be different from existing ones! ({{errorline}})
notEnoughPermissionsForFields: Insufficient permission to change requested fields ({{errorline}})
enabledToModifyFields: To modify any Wi-Fi field, it must be previously enabled ({{errorline}})
cpeWithoutFunction: CPE does not have this function! ({{errorline}})
acRuleLimits: The device limit blocked for this CPE has been reached. ({{errorline}})
useCommasToCombineFilters: Use commas to combine the desired filters. (Example: TP-Link, 0001-aix)
searchForMacIdPppoeUser: Search by MAC, Serial ID, User ID or PPPoE user...
greenRedGrayLegendTooltip:
Green: Online
Red: Unstable. No immediate response
Grey: No response for more than 1 hour
wanIpTooltip:
IPv4 at the top.
IPv6 at the bottom.
userWithoutPermissionToVisualizeInformat: User not allowed to view information
deviceTooltip: Ask the customer to connect the device to the CPE. You can also enter the MAC address of the device
openPortsToolTip: Open ports will have a one-to-one mapping. That is, the port X open on the device will be mapped to the same port X on the CPE. For asymmetric ports, separate the ports with ':'. Ex: 80:8080
DmzTooltip: IPv4 only. When enabling the DMZ, the device will be on a network isolated from the LAN network. Devices on the LAN network will still be able to communicate with devices in the DMZ
opennedPortsTooltip: If you don't see the ports listed, update the CPE firmware
someCpeFormFieldAreInvalid: Some fields on the CPE form are not filled in properly
informAtLeastOnePortToOpenAccess: Enter at least one port to allow access!
cpeDoesNotSupportAsymmetricPorts: CPE does not support asymmetric ports! Update firmware.
willOnlyAcceptValueWifiBandwidth: Only the values auto, HT20,HT40,VHT20,VHT40 and VHT80 are accepted
willOnlyAcceptValueWifiPower: Only the values 25%, 50%, 75% and 100% are accepted
thisFieldMustHaveAtLeastMinChars: This field must be at least {{-min}} characters
someEspecialCharactersAccentCedileAreNot: Accent letters, cedilla, and some special characters are not accepted
acceptableCharsAre0-9a-zA-Z .-ul: Only alphanumeric characters, spaces, period, - and _ are accepted
acceptableCharsAre0-9a-zA-Z.-ul: Only alphanumeric characters, period, - and _ are accepted
thisFieldMustHaveValidIpFormat: This field must contain a valid IP format
thisFieldCannotHaveTheValueValItIsReserv: This field cannot contain the value {{-val}}. The value is reserved.
invalidValueToDeactiveIpv6: Invalid value to enable or disable IPv6
wanConfiguratonDidNotChange: WAN configuration has not been changed
cpeDiagnosticNotDone: The diagnosis of EPC was not made
meshNetworkConfigurationDidNotChange: Mesh network configuration has not been changed
wifiConfigurationDidNotChange: Wi-Fi setting has not been changed
parametersUsedAsStandardValueForAllDevic: Parameters used as default values on all devices.
generalDataCollectingOperationForAllDevi: General operation of data collection on all devices.
standardValueForAllDevicesWithoutOwnValu: Default value for all devices that do not have their own individual value.
canOnlyBy100: For now it can only be 100
parametersHereWillBeAppliedToAllSelected: The parameters defined here will be applied to all devices listed in the current search performed. Fields with no value, or blank, will not be recorded, the values already existing in each device will be kept.
wifiCollection: Data collection from devices connected to Wi-Fi
ifCollectingIsOffDeviceWillBehaveAsOff: If the collection service is not turned on, active devices will behave as inactive devices.
ifCollectingIsOffThisMeasureWillNotHappe: If the collection service is not turned on, this device will not perform this collection.
usedByAllDevicesBlankMeansNoChange: Used by all devices. Blank field means this setting will not be changed.
dataCollectingPingFqdnTooltip: IPv4, IPv6 or DNS address. Empty field makes the device follow the default value of the service.
oneRegisteredVlanIsNecessary!: At least one registered VLAN Profile is required!
targetAddressesTooltip: Destination addresses can be websites on the Internet or valid IP addresses
oneOrMoreAddrsNotSaved: One or more addresses could not be saved
forTr069OnlyFirstAddressWillBeTested: For TR-069 devices only the first destination address will be tested
ipNeedsTobeInTheSameCpeSubnetRange: IP must be in the same subnet range as the CPE
tr069AdvancedOptionsTooltip: Enables friendlier ways to open a set of ports
tr069RangeOfPortsTooltip: Allows opening a sequence of ports, passing an initial port and an end port
tr069AsymPortOpenningTooltip: Allows you to associate a common external port(Source Port) with a specific internal port(Destination Port)
devicesPortsTooltip: Remove all port mappings for this device
tr069PortOpenningIncompatibilityMessage: The model {{-model}} version {{-version}} does not support the following ways of opening ports:
tr069ValidPortsInstructions: The ports must be in the range between 1 - 65535! (Due to the particular application of the TR-069 device, the following ports are also not allowed: 22, 23, 80, 443, 7547 and 58000)
portRangesAreDifferentInSize!: The port strips are different sizes!
portRangesHaveLimitsInverted: The port ranges are upside down!
selectWhichCpesInNetworkToRestart: Select which network CPEs to restart
oneOrMoreCommandCouldNotBeSent!: Could not send one or more commands!
diagnosticInProgress: Command could not be started as there is already a diagnostic in progress.
colorFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter only online (green), unstable (red), or offline (grey) CPEs
biggerThanFilterDescription: Replace H with the desired number of hours. Includes results from CPEs that have been offline or online for a period equal to or greater than the specified number of hours. Example: "offline >48" will display CPEs that have been offline for 48 hours or more, and "online >48" will display CPEs that have been online and connected to the network for 48 hours or more
updateOnFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter only CPEs marked for update
updateOffFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter only CPEs not marked for update
cpeTypeFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter only entries that use TR-069 or only those with Flashbox firmware
opticalSignalQualityFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter TR-069 CPEs by the level of the optical signal received. The values used in the classification are the same as those configured for the technician app.
ipv6EnabledFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter out the CPEs that have ipv6 enabled, disabled or unknown.
meshEnabledFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter out the CPEs that have mesh mode enabled or disabled.
cpeModeFilterDescription: Use one of these filters to filter out CPEs that are operating in Router Mode or Bridge Mode / AP Mode.
orFilterDescription: Includes results that contain one or more filters applied. Example: "John","online","/or" will display all CPEs that are online, or contain "John", or are online and contains "Jo√£o" in the register
andFilterDescription: Includes results that contain all applied filters. Example: "John","online","/e" will display all CPEs that are online and contain "John" in the register
excludeFilterDescription: Excludes results for CPEs that have the search term. Example: "online","/exclude 9999-aix" will display all CPEs that are online and do not contain the 9999-aix release of Flashbox
showsitesurveyAlertInfo: The best channel recommendation must be changed manually. The "auto" mechanism of the CPE may differ from the recommendation presented here.
showsitesurveyTR069WarningInfo: The Wi-Fi must be enabled for the TR-069 site survey command to work.
clickButtonBelowToStartMeasure: Click the button below to start measurement
youShouldWait20SecBetweenMeasures: You must wait 20 seconds between measurements
speedTestWarningMessage: To ensure the accuracy of the speed test, internet access from customer devices is temporarily stopped. Make sure the customer is aware of this procedure before starting it!
errorOccurredTryAgain: An error occurred. Please try again
serverBusyTryAgain: Server is busy, please try later
letsSelectWhichCpesWillUpate?: Shall we select which CPEs to update?
csvFileFormatDescriptionTooltip: CSV files must have the MAC of each CPE in the first column, using the comma (,) as a separator and must not have a header. The record delimiter must be a line break.
checkIfGivenDataIsCorrect: Verify that the data provided is correct.
letsSelectWhichReleaseToInstall?: Shall we select which release to install?
rememberToCreateAFirmwareWithThisRelease: Remember to generate firmware with this release for all models!
XOfYSelectedCpesWillUpdate!: Warning! Currently {{-x}} of the selected {{y}} CPEs will be updated!
onuSelectedToUpdate: Among the selected ones, {{-x}} are TR-069 CPEs or CPEs in a mesh network where the main one is a TR-069 CPE and therefore will not be updated.
meshSelectedToUpdate: Of the selected ones, {{-x}} are CPEs configured in a mesh network in the new standard and the chosen release is only compatible with the mesh in the old standard. Therefore, they will not be updated.
meshRolesSelectedToUpdate: Among the selected ones, {{-x}} are CPEs configured in a mesh network in the old standard and the main one is not compatible in the new standard or one of the secondary ones is not compatible in the new standard. Therefore, they will not be updated.
warningMissingModelsToUpdate!: The models below do not have firmware for this release, and will be excluded from this schedule. Add the following missing firmware to update all CPEs!
letsSelectWhenCpesWillUpdate?: Will we select when the CPEs will be updated?
startAndEndTimesCannotBeEqual!: Start and end times cannot be the same!
csvFileHasBeenUsedToFilterCpes: A CSV file was used to filter the CPEs
serverErrorPleaseTryAgain: A server error has occurred. Please try again.
pressOkToRefreshPage: Press OK to reload the page
abortScheduleWarningMessage: When you abort the schedule, all devices that have not yet been updated will have their update discarded, needing a new schedule to update them. Do you want to continue anyway?
abortScheduleProgressToDoWarningMessage: Some CPEs have already started the update process, and will not be interrupted by aborting the schedule. Export the CSV with the results to see which CPEs were still updating.
newScheduleModalMessage: Results can be seen by exporting the CSV file. To start another schedule it is necessary to reload the page. Do you want to reload it now?
waitingDevicesToBecomeOnline: Waiting for devices to come online
lastCpeResetDoneAt: Last reset on CPE performed on
changeBridgeModeWarning: This CPE is in bridge mode! To change {{-interface}} data, take the CPE out of bridge mode first.
carefulThisCouldLeaveCpeInaccessible: Caution! This may make the CPE inaccessible depending on your provider's network settings
networkIpCalculationDescription: Network IP will be calculated from the chosen CPE IP and Mask
needRebootAfterChangeWanWarning: This CPE needs to reboot after WAN settings are modified
bridgeModeWorkingExplantion: To guarantee functioning in bridge mode, the device in front of the Flashbox on your network must have a DHCP server for both IPv4 and IPv6
fixedIpForCpeInBridge: Fixed IP of the bridged CPE
carefulMakeSureYourNetworkCanGiveFixedIp: Be careful! Make sure your network is configured to deliver the chosen fixed IP, otherwise the CPE may be inaccessible!
sureYouWantToRemoveRegister?: Are you sure you want to remove this record?
factoryResetAbortMessage: Cannot reset to factory firmware from installed version of Flashbox. Please update Flashbox to version 0.28.0 or higher first, then reset to factory firmware.
thisCpeWillLoseAllItsConfigurations: This CPE will lose all settings. This action can only be undone with a new installation via the Flashbox Wizard.
couldnotRestoreStockFirmwareTryAgain: Could not restore CPE to factory firmware. Please try again.
routerDisassociateMeshConfirmation: Are you sure you want to disassociate this CPE from the mesh network?
factoryResetRebootInstructions: Wait for the CPE to restart, then hold the reset button for 15 seconds.
youNeedToLogInAgain: You will need to login again
newFlashmanVersionNeedsManualInstallPlea: The new version of Flashman requires a manual installation. Please go to our documentation page and follow the steps to update your Flashman to the new version. If you need to, please contact the Anlix team.
wouldYouLikeToInstallNewVersionNow?: Do you want to install the new version now?
minimumAmountOfPppoePaswordChars: Minimum number of characters for the PPPoE password
warningPrefixWiFi: Caution! Enabling the prefix for newly registered devices will force a change in their SSID values, if they don't already have a prefix. Changes in the prefix settings will NOT affect devices already registered in Flashman. Remember the prefix is case sensitive!
thisFieldCannotHaveMoreThanMaxChars: This field cannot be longer than {{-max}} characters
acceptableCharsAre0-9a-zA-Z .-#: Alphanumeric characters, spaces, period, -, and # are accepted
acceptableCharsAre0-9a-zA-Z .-ul#: Alphanumeric characters, spaces, period, -, _ and # are accepted
endingSeparatorMustHaveAtLeastOne.-ul#: Must have at least one period, -, _ or # as separator at the end
enableSsidPrefixInCpesWifi: Enable SSID prefix for newly registered CPEs as they connect to Flashman
removeDeviceAndBlockLicenseWarning: When selecting the option "$t(removeAndBlock)", in addition to removing the CPE, the license will also be blocked
removeDevicesAndBlockLicensesWarning: When selecting the option "$t(removeAndBlock)", in addition to removing the CPEs, the licenses will also be blocked
adminSetLicenseToBeBlockedAtDeviceRemova: The administrator has set that all removed CPEs must have their licenses blocked
mustBlockLicenseAtDeviceRemoval: Mandatory license blocking when removing CPEs from the Flashman database
speedMeasureServerIpAddress: IP address of the speed measurement server
technicianAppConfigurations: Settings for technician app (Android and Desktop)
insertValidDbmNumber: Please enter a valid dBm number
ponSignalConfigAlsoApplyToApp: The optical signal settings also apply to the Technician App (Android and Desktop)
disabledWanStepWillBePingTestToCpeGatewa: The step to be disabled on the WAN will be the ping test done to the CPE gateway
disabledFlashmanRegisterStepWillBeMqttsC: The step to disable in the Flashman registry includes testing for an active MQTTS connection for CPEs using Flashbox firmware
cpesWebinterfaceLogin: Login to the CPEs web interface
cpesWebinterfacePassword: Password for the CPEs web interface
onuWebPasswordTooltip: Password must be 8 to 16 characters long, contain at least one uppercase letter, one lowercase letter, one number, and one special character. The special character cannot be the first character!
stunEnableTooltip: Required for CPEs to be fully communicable by Flashman when behind NAT (supported models only)
enableTr069HttpCommunicationMode: Enable HTTP mode in TR-069 communication
tr069HttpCommunicationTooltip: Necessary so that CPEs that do not support the HTTPS protocol can communicate with Flashman
lostInformsForUnstableCpe: Reports not received for unstable CPE
lostInformsForOfflineCpe: Reports not received for CPE offline
lostInformsRecoveryOfflineThresholdsInva: Value for unstable must be less than the offline value
warningLargeLoadFlashman: Warning! This procedure can generate a large load of data in Flashman, which will affect its performance. Use with caution!
unstableShouldBeLessThanOffline: Unstable must be less than offline
OfflineShouldBeBiggerThanUnstable: Offline needs to be bigger than unstable
errorsInOneOrMoreConfigurationsFields: There are errors in one or more configuration fields
enablingTr069HttpCommunicationMustReadAn: To enable HTTP mode in TR-069 communication, it is necessary to read and agree to our Terms of good practices in network security
registerPermissionsAndActionsInCpes: Registration permissions and actions in CPEs
actionsInCpeControl: Control of Shares in the CPE
cpeLicenseBlockAtRemoval: Allow license blocking at CPEs removal
cannotSearchAndView: Do not allow searching and viewing
noCertificatesFoundWithTheseParameters: No certification was found with these parameters!
meshNetworkHasNoSecondaryCpes: Mesh network has no secondary CPEs
cpeModelsHaveDifferentVlanIdMaxValues: CPE models have different maximum VLAN ID values
uniquenessRule: must be distinct from existing ones
vlanIdLengthRule: VLAN ID cannot be less than 3 or greater than 4094
Name: Name
vlanProfileNameUniquenessRule: The name of the VLAN Profile $t(uniquenessRule)
vlanProfileNameCharRules: The VLAN Profile name cannot be empty, it must start with an alphabet character, contain alphanumeric characters, hyphen or underscore
vlanDeleteWarning: There may be devices whose VLAN configuration uses these VLAN profiles. Proceeding with this exclusion will associate the ports that are associated with these VLAN profiles with the default VLAN profile. Do you want to continue anyway?
cannotDeleteVlanProfileCpesDidNotUpdateV: Deletion of profiles was not possible as some CPEs did not update the VLAN configuration.
arrayElementNotFound: No element found for the given index
alertFilterDescription: Use this filters to return only CPEs that have an alert.
factoryCredentialsNotFound: Could not find a valid custom web credentials configuration
factoryCredentialsGenericError: An error has occurred while searching for the custom web credentials configuration
duplicatedCredentials: The model {{-model}} already has a custom web credentials configuration
emptyHostError: The host field cannot be empty!
defaultHostsConfigWarning: Careful! This procedure will overwrite the latency diagnostic hosts list for every CPE in the database.
unableToRemoveADefaultHost: Removing a default host is not allowed
hostListMustContainDefaultHosts: The list of hosts must contain the default hosts {{-hosts}}
updateSingleDeviceTimeWarning: The firmware update takes approximately 3 minutes. The CPE should not be turned off during this procedure. Inform your customer before proceeding.
updateSlaveDeviceTimeWarning: The firmware update takes approximately 3 minutes for each CPE. This update will affect all {{slaveCount}} routers in the mesh network, and will take about {{slaveCount3}} minutes in total. No CPE should be turned off during this procedure. Inform your customer before proceeding.
updateDeviceMeshError: The mesh network update process was interrupted. We do not recommend leaving mesh CPEs from the same network in different versions, so make sure this update resumes soon.
updateDeviceFirmwareErrorWithMAC: There was an error downloading the firmware from CPE with MAC {{errorMac}}. Please try again or cancel the procedure.
portOpeningRebootAlert: Careful! This model requires a reboot in order to apply port forward configuration changes.
